fields.name: St. Mary's Nyakhobi Senior School
fields.tagline: Excellence Through Discipline - Building Leaders for Tomorrow
fields.welcome_message: St. Mary's Nyakhobi Senior School is a prestigious mixed secondary school located in Funyula, Busia County, Kenya. Established in 2010, we have consistently delivered quality education and produced graduates who excel in various fields. Our commitment to academic excellence, discipline, and character development makes us a preferred choice for parents seeking quality education for their children.
fields.mission_statement: To provide quality, affordable, and accessible education that prepares students for success in their academic pursuits and future careers while instilling strong moral values and developing responsible citizens who contribute positively to society.
fields.vision_statement: To be a leading educational institution in Kenya, recognized for academic excellence, innovation, character development, and producing graduates who are competitive in the global market.
fields.address: Off Nambuku/Funyula Road, Funyula, P.O. Box 123, Funyula 50406, Busia County, Kenya

fields.name: Form 1
fields.description: Foundation year focusing on core subjects and study skills development

fields.name: Form 2
fields.description: Skills development year with expanded curriculum including computer studies

fields.name: Form 3
fields.description: Specialization year where students choose between Sciences and Arts streams

fields.name: Form 4
fields.description: KCSE preparation year with intensive revision and mock examinations

fields.name: Mathematics
fields.description: Pure and applied mathematics, statistics, and problem-solving skills

fields.name: English
fields.description: Language and literature, communication skills, and creative writing

fields.name: Kiswahili
fields.description: National language, literature, and cultural studies

fields.name: Biology
fields.description: Life sciences, human biology, and environmental studies

fields.name: Chemistry
fields.description: Chemical processes, laboratory work, and scientific analysis

fields.name: Physics
fields.description: Physical sciences, mechanics, and scientific principles

fields.name: History
fields.description: World history, African history, and historical analysis

fields.name: Geography
fields.description: Physical geography, human geography, and environmental studies

fields.name: Form 1 Academic Program
fields.description: Foundation building year focusing on core subjects including Mathematics, English, Kiswahili, Science, Social Studies, and Religious Education. Students are introduced to secondary education with comprehensive curriculum coverage and study skills development.

fields.name: Form 2 Academic Program
fields.description: Skills development year with expanded curriculum including Computer Studies, Business Studies, and advanced science subjects. Students begin exploring their academic interests and career paths while building on foundation knowledge.
fields.requirements: Successful completion of Form 1 with satisfactory performance

fields.name: Form 3 Academic Program
fields.description: Specialization year where students choose between Sciences stream (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics) and Arts stream (History, Geography, Literature, Languages) based on their career aspirations and academic strengths.
fields.requirements: Successful completion of Form 2 with good academic performance

fields.name: Form 4 KCSE Program
fields.description: Final year KCSE preparation program with intensive revision, comprehensive mock examinations, university application guidance, and career counseling. Students receive specialized support to excel in national examinations.
fields.requirements: Successful completion of Form 3 in chosen stream

fields.name: Mathematics Department
fields.description: Mathematics, Statistics, and Computer Studies with emphasis on problem-solving and analytical thinking

fields.name: Sciences Department
fields.description: Physics, Chemistry, Biology with focus on practical laboratory work and scientific research methods

fields.name: Languages Department
fields.description: English, Kiswahili, Literature with emphasis on communication skills and creative expression

fields.name: Humanities Department
fields.description: History, Geography, Christian Religious Education, and Business Studies

fields.bio: With over 15 years of experience in educational leadership, Mr. Wanyama leads St. Mary's Nyakhobi with vision and dedication to academic excellence. He holds a Master's degree in Educational Leadership and has transformed the school into one of the leading institutions in Busia County.
fields.qualifications: M.Ed Educational Leadership (University of Nairobi), B.Ed Mathematics (Moi University)

fields.bio: Mrs. Adhiambo oversees our academic programs and ensures high standards of teaching and learning across all subjects. She brings 12 years of experience in science education and curriculum development.
fields.qualifications: M.Sc Chemistry (University of Nairobi), B.Ed Chemistry (Kenyatta University)

fields.bio: Mr. Ochieng manages the administrative affairs and ensures smooth operations of all school activities. He has 10 years of experience in educational administration and business management.
fields.qualifications: MBA Management (Maseno University), B.Com Business (Moi University)

fields.bio: Head of Mathematics Department with 12 years of teaching experience. Specializes in KCSE preparation and has consistently produced excellent results in national examinations.
fields.qualifications: B.Ed Mathematics & Physics (Kenyatta University), Diploma in Education

fields.bio: Head of Sciences Department with 10 years of experience in science education. Expert in laboratory management and has mentored several students to excel in science competitions.
fields.qualifications: B.Sc Chemistry (University of Nairobi), PGDE (Kenyatta University)

fields.bio: Dedicated Physics and Mathematics teacher with 8 years of experience. Known for making complex concepts easy to understand and has helped many students improve their performance.
fields.qualifications: B.Ed Physics & Mathematics (Moi University), Diploma in Education

fields.bio: Head of Languages Department with 15 years of experience in language education. Drama club coordinator and debate coach who has led the school to several victories in inter-school competitions.
fields.qualifications: B.A English & Literature (University of Nairobi), PGDE (Kenyatta University)

fields.bio: Experienced Kiswahili teacher with 9 years of dedication to language and cultural education. Has authored several educational materials and promotes African cultural values.
fields.qualifications: B.A Kiswahili & Literature (Pwani University), Diploma in Education

fields.bio: Head of Humanities Department with 11 years of experience in social studies education. Specializes in African history and has conducted research on local historical sites.
fields.qualifications: B.A History & Government (University of Nairobi), PGDE (Kenyatta University)

fields.bio: Geography teacher with 7 years of experience focusing on environmental conservation and sustainable development. Leads the school's environmental club and tree planting initiatives.
fields.qualifications: B.Ed Geography (Masinde Muliro University), Diploma in Environmental Studies

fields.title: Inter-School Athletics Championship 2025
fields.description: Annual athletics competition featuring schools from Busia County. Track and field events for all age groups including 100m, 200m, 400m, 800m, 1500m, 5000m races, relay competitions, long jump, high jump, shot put, and discus throw. Expected participation from over 20 schools.

fields.title: Annual Science Fair 2025
fields.description: Students showcase innovative science projects and experiments across various categories including Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, Computer Science, and Environmental Science. Open to parents, guardians, and the local community. Awards will be given for outstanding projects.

fields.title: Drama and Cultural Festival
fields.description: Annual celebration of arts and creativity featuring original plays, poetry recitations, traditional dances, and musical performances. Students from all forms participate in showcasing talents in drama, music, dance, and storytelling representing various Kenyan cultures.

fields.title: Form 4 KCSE Mock Examinations
fields.description: Comprehensive mock examinations for Form 4 students in preparation for the national KCSE exams. Covers all subjects with proper examination conditions, invigilation, and marking schemes following KNEC standards.

fields.title: Parents Day & Academic Exhibition
fields.description: Parents and guardians meet with teachers for academic progress discussions, view student exhibitions, and participate in school activities. Includes presentation of student work, departmental displays, and feedback sessions with class teachers.

fields.title: Annual Awards Day & Prize Giving Ceremony
fields.description: Recognition of outstanding academic performance, sports achievements, leadership, and exemplary conduct. Presentation of trophies, certificates, scholarships, and bursaries to deserving students. Guest speaker from the education sector.
